post.description:
Here is the url format to build on your side to get a custom signature interface with your settings : 
https://webapp.yousign.com/procedure/sign?members=~2Fmembers~2F__MEMBER_ID__&signatureUi=~2Fsignature_uis~2F__SIGNATURE_UI_ID__

Users.description: A User is not only a signer or validator. Each additional User will be allowed to use Yousign application and **will be charged** in addition to existing Users. For more information, please visit our website : https://yousign.com/prix/or contact our sales team on hello@yousign.fr.

User Groups.description: A User Group is associated with a combination of permissions available in the Yousign application (Manager, Signer, Admin, ...).

Files.description: Defines the PDF files you want to sign with Yousign.

Procedures.description: A procedure is an invitation to sign one or more signers for one or more documents.

Members.description: Defines a signer or a validator on a Procedure. It means the member is a contributor of the Procedure.

Signature UIs.description:
Customization templates for the Signature User Interfaces.
This feature **won't be available on Basic API plan** and **will be available only on Premium and Ultimate API plans**.
This allows you to change the signature interface with your graphic chart and gives you access to modify the logo, colors, fonts and many other elements of personalization.

Server Stamp.description: Allows to sign document by server stamp

items.description:
You can given an array of recipients.

A recipient can be a specific email like `my-user@email.com` or a variable which is available in the list below.

url.description: Custom URL for the Organization (internal usage only, should not be used)

fSso.description: Internal usage, should not be used

maxUsers.description: Internal usage, should not be used

autoCollection.description: Internal usage, should not be used

vatNumber.description: Internal usage, should not be used

inAppUpdates.description: Internal usage, should not be used

fServerStamp.description: Internal usage, should not be used

fOperationCustomModeEmail.description: Internal usage, should not be used

fDynamicFields.description: Internal usage, should not be used

fProcedureRelatedFiles.description: Defined if the organization enable the related files

samlIdentityProvider.description: Internal usage, should not be used

passwordPolicyPattern.description: Pattern of the password policy for the organization

userActivation.description: Internal usage, should not be used

fProcedureTemplatePermissions.description: Internal usage, should not be used

email.description: User's email address (This field is allowed only during creation)

phone.description: User's phone number (mobiles and landline telephones are supported). Phone number must be formatted to E164 (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) which includes the symbol '+' and the country code. For example : +33612131315. All countries are supported.

notifications.description: Defines if the notifications are enable ou disable for entities

phone.description: User's phone number (mobiles and landline telephones are supported). Phone number must be formatted to E164 (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) which includes the symbol '+' and the country code. For example : +33612131315. All countries are supported.

organization.description: ID of the organization the user belongs to

workspaces.description: List of workspaces to which the user is connected and has access

deleted.description: Defines if the User is deleted or not

inweboUserRequest.description: Internal usage, should not be used

defaultSignImage.description: ID of the default sign image.

notifications.description: Defines if the notifications are enable ou disable for entities

fastSign.description: Defines if the fast signature is available for the user on the Yousign application

content.description: Content in base 64 of the file

expiresAt.description: Expiration date. The procedure will be out of usage after this date.

template.description: Defines if the procedure is a template (if true). A template could be used by a procedure to get all properties of the template. Check parent parameter for more information.

ordered.description: Defines an order for the procedure process. If true, position of each member will be used to define the validation workflow.

metadata.description: Metadata of the file (do not forget to replace key1 and key2 by your own custom values)

members.description: List of members, REQUIRED if start field is true.

start.description: Defines if the procedure has been started. If false, the procedure status will be draft.

archive.description: Defines if the files of the procedure must be archived (Organization should be allowed)

start.description: Defines if the new procedure should be started after the duplication

template.description: Override the parent value for this property and defines if the new procedure should be a template or not

interval.description: Number of days between each reminder. The date of the creation of the procedure is used to define the date of the reminder. For example, if you set 2 and the procedure is created at 2017-01-01T15:03:01, the first reminder will be sent at 2017-01-03T15:03:01.

expiresAt.description: Expiration date. The procedure will be out of usage after this date.

creator.description: Id of creator of the object

workspace.description: Id of workspace creator of the object

template.description: Defines if the procedure is a template (if true). A template could be used by a procedure to get all properties of the template. Check parent parameter for more information.

ordered.description: Defines an order for the procedure process. If true, position of each member will be used to define the validation workflow.

parent.description: Id of a procedure template used to get all properties of the template in the new procedure. If you set other properties, they will be replaced. If you don’t set other properties, all properties will be cloned.

files.description: List of files used in the procedure.

relatedFilesEnable.description: Defines if related files are available.

archive.description: Defines if the files of the procedure must be archived (Workspace should be allowed)

user.description:
ID of the user in your companies. Informations about the member will be duplicate (first name, last name, email and phone number).

Required if none of fields above are specified.

type.description: Type of a member. "signer" to sign documents (legally) and "validator" to validate documents.

firstname.description: Firstname of an external member. Required if user field is blank

lastname.description: Lastname of an external member. Required if user field is blank

email.description: Email of an external member. Required if user field is blank

phone.description: Phone of an external member. Required if user field is blank

position.description:
If the procedure have the boolean "ordered" at true, you can define position of the order to invite your members to sign.
Only the first member will be invited to sign.

When the first member have signed, the second will be invited, etc...

user.description: Internal user associated with the member. In this case, informations about the member will be informations of the user (first name, last name, phone number and email).

type.description: Type of a member. "signer" to sign documents (legally) and "validator" to validate documents.

position.description: Position of the member if ordered is set to true. Example with two members, the first one could have a position set to 1, the second one set to 2. In this case, when the procedure starts, only the first member will be notified and could validate the documents. The second one could not validate the documents, he will be notified when the first signer is notified.

comment.description: Comment of a member when he refuses a signature

content.description: Content of your custom sms message. Should contains the substring `{{code}}`
content.example: Hello, your code for signature is {{code}}.

page.description:
Page of the visible signature. This property is ignored if fieldName is set. 
If you want a visible signature, you must set page, position and fieldName.

position.description: Coordinates of the signature image to set. Format is : "llx,lly,urx,ury". llx=left lower x coordinate, lly=left lower y coordinate, urx=upper right x coordinate, ury = upper right y coordinate. To get easily coordinates, you could use this tool : http://placeit.yousign.fr

fieldName.description: [type=signature] Name of the signature field existing in the document, it will be not used on the signature image.

mention.description:
[type=signature] Text associated above the signature image.

You can use some variable inside : {{date.en}} {{date.fr}} {{time}} that it will be parsed to show the date of the signature.

mention2.description:
[type=signature] Text associated below the signature image. (internal usage only, should not be used).

You can use some variable inside : {{date.en}} {{date.fr}} {{time}} that it will be parsed to show the date of the signature.

reason.description: [type=signature] The reason they are signing the agreement

type.description: The type of the file object

contentRequired.description: [type=text] Indicate if the member must fill or not the field

content.description: [type=text] The content of the field. Could be used for placeholder

fontFamily.description: [type=text] The font familly used to render the TextField. Currently only the default value will be used.

fontSize.description: [type=text] The font size used to render the field. Currently only the default value will be used.

fontColor.description: [type=text] The font color used to render the field.

enableDocumentList.description: Toggle list of documents in the procedure

authenticationPopup.description: True for use a popup to enter the SMS code, false for use a fullscreen view.

defaultZoom.description: Default value for zoom of the PDF viewer. Default value is the adapted to the resolution of your screen.

signImageTypesAvailable.description: Allow sign images types available for signature. The first type of the list will be selected as default for the signer.

defaultLanguage.description: Default selected language of the interface. Must be present in "languages" field.

languages.description: Array of allowed languages, use country code

fonts.description: List of fonts to load on the view. (Loaded via Google fonts)
